author: Michael Larabel
description: When it comes to open-source games, Unvanquished remains one of the most promising and interesting open-source FPS games from a technical perspective. With its next release, Unvanquished has been ported to the SDL3 library and is working well natively on Wayland...
title: Unvanquished Game Ported To SDL3, Working Natively On Wayland

author: Michael Larabel
description: Thirteen years after the AMD GCN 1.0 "Southern Islands" GPUs initially launched as the Radeon HD 7000 series, recently there has been an effort to improve the support for both GCN 1.0 and the GCN 1.1 graphics processors with their open-source Linux driver stack. This recent effort has been led by one of the developers on Valve's Linux graphics team...
title: Linux Driver Developer At Valve Preps More Patches For Improving AMD GCN 1.0 GPUs

author: Michael Larabel
description: Linux engineer at Microsoft Christian Brauner sent out his set of 12 pull requests touching the VFS portion of the Linux kernel. These changes for the Linux 6.18 kernel include one pull request that touches the writeback code to address a situation of lockups being reported by users when systemd units read lots of files...
title: Linux 6.18 Will Fix Lockups When Systemd Units Read Lots Of Files

author: Michael Larabel
description: Among the early pull requests submitted already to Linus Torvalds in advance of the Linux 6.18 merge window opening soon is the Btrfs file-system updates. Btrfs for Linux 6.18 has a few items worth calling out but no major features this cycle...
title: Btrfs Brings BS Greater Than PS For Linux 6.18, Better Parallelism For Read-Heavy Workloads

author: Michael Larabel
description: The sched_ext scheduler framework that allows creating kernel thread schedulers via BPF programs is ready with some updates for the Linux 6.18 kernel...
title: Linux 6.18 sched_ext Preps For Cgroup Sub-Scheduler Support

author: Michael Larabel
description: Following last week's KDE Plasma 6.5 beta release, the focus has shifted to bug fixing ahead of the October release of Plasma 6.5.0. There have been some minor features to still squeeze in, a lot of bug fixing has commenced, and also some early feature work around Plasma 6.6...
title: KDE Plasma 6.5 Receives A Grayscale Mode, Early Feature Work Toward Plasma 6.6
